title: The TVLine-Up: What’s Returning, New and Leaving the Week of Nov. 10
description: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch listings and our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. […]
author: Ryan Schwartz
excerpt: Yellowstone, Bad Sisters, Cobra Kai and Silo return this week. Plus, Cross, St. Denis Medical and The Day of the Jackal debut — see full list.
text: This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch listings and our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming. With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll. This week, you’ll find five returning shows (including Yellowstone and Silo), eight series premieres (including Cross and St. Denis Medical), eight finales (including The Penguin and American Sports Story) and so much more. SUNDAY, NOV. 108 pm Yellowstone Season 5B premiere (Paramount Network)9 pm The Penguin limited series finale (HBO) MONDAY, NOV. 119 pm My Brilliant Friend series finale (HBO) TUESDAY, NOV. 123 am Deadpool & Wolverine streaming premiere (Disney+)3 am Larger Than Life: Reign of the Boybands documentary premiere (Paramount+)8 pm Dancing With the Stars Episode No. 500 (ABC, Disney+)8 pm St. Denis Medical series premiere (NBC; two episodes)10 pm American Sports Story Season 1 finale (FX)10 pm High Potential fall finale (ABC) WEDNESDAY, NOV. 133 am Bad Sisters Season 2 premiere (Apple TV+; first two episodes)3 am Emilia Pérez movie premiere (Netflix)3 am Hot Frosty movie premiere (Netflix)3 am Return of the King: The Fall and Rise of Elvis Presley documentary premiere (Netflix)8 pm The Golden Bachelorette Season 1 finale (ABC) THURSDAY, NOV. 143 am Cross series premiere (Prime Video; all eight episodes)3 am The Day of the Jackal limited series premiere (Peacock; first five episodes)3 am Frasier Season 2 finale (Paramount+)3 am Holidazed series premiere (Hallmark+; first two episodes)3 am Say Nothing series premiere (Hulu; all nine episodes)3 am Sherwood Season 2 premiere (BritBox; first two episodes)8 pm Harry Potter: Wizards of Baking series premiere (Food Network)9 pm The Real Housewives of Orange County Season 18 reunion, Part 2 of 2 (Bravo) FRIDAY, NOV. 153 am An Almost Christmas Story short film premiere (Disney+)3 am Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 premiere (Netflix; five episodes)3 am The Creep Tapes series premiere (AMC+, Shudder; first two episodes)3 am It’s All Country series premiere (Hulu; all six episodes)3 am The Night Before Christmas in Wonderland movie premiere (Prime Video)3 am Silo Season 2 premiere (Apple TV+)3 am Twisters streaming premiere (Peacock)8 pm Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson live special (Netflix)10 pm Three Women limited series finale (Starz) SATURDAY, NOV. 169 pm Have I Got News for You Season 1 finale (CNN) Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line. 2024 Christmas Movie Guide
html:
This weekly feature is in addition to TVLine’s daily What to Watch listings and our monthly breakdown of What’s on Streaming.

With over 500 scripted shows now airing across broadcast, cable and streaming, it’s easy to forget that a favorite comedy is returning, or that the new “prestige drama” you anticipated is about to debut. So consider this our reminder to set your DVR, order a Season Pass, pop a fresh Memorex into the VCR… however it is you roll.

This week, you’ll find five returning shows (including Yellowstone and Silo), eight series premieres (including Cross and St. Denis Medical), eight finales (including The Penguin and American Sports Story) and so much more.

SUNDAY, NOV. 10
8 pm Yellowstone Season 5B premiere (Paramount Network)
9 pm The Penguin limited series finale (HBO)

MONDAY, NOV. 11
9 pm My Brilliant Friend series finale (HBO)

TUESDAY, NOV. 12
3 am Deadpool & Wolverine streaming premiere (Disney+)
3 am Larger Than Life: Reign of the Boybands documentary premiere (Paramount+)
8 pm Dancing With the Stars Episode No. 500 (ABC, Disney+)
8 pm St. Denis Medical series premiere (NBC; two episodes)
10 pm American Sports Story Season 1 finale (FX)
10 pm High Potential fall finale (ABC)

WEDNESDAY, NOV. 13
3 am Bad Sisters Season 2 premiere (Apple TV+; first two episodes)
3 am Emilia Pérez movie premiere (Netflix)
3 am Hot Frosty movie premiere (Netflix)
3 am Return of the King: The Fall and Rise of Elvis Presley documentary premiere (Netflix)
8 pm The Golden Bachelorette Season 1 finale (ABC)

THURSDAY, NOV. 14
3 am Cross series premiere (Prime Video; all eight episodes)
3 am The Day of the Jackal limited series premiere (Peacock; first five episodes)
3 am Frasier Season 2 finale (Paramount+)
3 am Holidazed series premiere (Hallmark+; first two episodes)
3 am Say Nothing series premiere (Hulu; all nine episodes)
3 am Sherwood Season 2 premiere (BritBox; first two episodes)
8 pm Harry Potter: Wizards of Baking series premiere (Food Network)
9 pm The Real Housewives of Orange County Season 18 reunion, Part 2 of 2 (Bravo)

FRIDAY, NOV. 15
3 am An Almost Christmas Story short film premiere (Disney+)
3 am Cobra Kai Season 6, Part 2 premiere (Netflix; five episodes)
3 am The Creep Tapes series premiere (AMC+, Shudder; first two episodes)
3 am It’s All Country series premiere (Hulu; all six episodes)
3 am The Night Before Christmas in Wonderland movie premiere (Prime Video)
3 am Silo Season 2 premiere (Apple TV+)
3 am Twisters streaming premiere (Peacock)
8 pm Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson live special (Netflix)
10 pm Three Women limited series finale (Starz)

SATURDAY, NOV. 16
9 pm Have I Got News for You Season 1 finale (CNN)

Want scoop on any of the above shows? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line.

2024 Christmas Movie Guide
